Questions: Questions [1. I have strong beliefs about what is right and wrong, good and bad.]
Questions [2. I often act without considering the possible consequences]
Questions [3. I tend to solve problems using a step-by-step approach]
Questions [4. I believe that formal procedures and policies restrict people]
Questions [5. I have a reputation for saying what I think, simply and directly]
Questions [6. I often find that actions based on feelings are as sound as those based on careful thought and analysis]
Questions [7. I like the sort of work where I have time for thorough preparation and implementation]
Questions [8. I regularly question people about their basic assumptions]
Questions [9. What matters most is whether something works in practice]
Questions [10. I actively seek out new experiences]
Questions [11. When I hear about a new idea or approach I immediately start working out how to apply it in practice]
Questions [12. I am keen on self discipline such as watching my diet, taking regular exercise, sticking to a fixed routine, etc.]
Questions [13. I take pride in doing a thorough job]
Questions [14. I get on best with logical, analytical people and less well with spontaneous, "irrational"]
Questions [15. I take care over the interpretation of data available to me and avoid jumping to conclusions]
Questions [16. I like to reach a decision carefully after weighing up many alternatives]
Questions [17. I'm attracted more to novel, unusual ideas than to practical ones]
Questions [18. I don't like disorganised things and prefer to fit things into a coherent pattern]
Questions [19. I accept and stick to laid down procedures and policies so long as I regard them as an efficient way of getting the job done]
Questions [20. I like to relate my actions to a general principle]
Questions [21. In discussions I like to get straight to the point]
Questions [22. I tend to have distant, rather formal relationships with people at work]
Questions [23. I thrive on the challenge of tackling something new and different]
Questions [24. I enjoy fun-loving, spontaneous people]
Questions [25. I pay meticulous attention to detail before coming to a conclusion]
Questions [26. I find it difficult to produce ideas on impulse]
Questions [27. I believe in coming to the point immediately]
Questions [28. I am careful not to jump to conclusions too quickly]
Questions [29. I prefer to have as many resources of information as possible - the more data to think over the better]
Questions [30. Flippant people who don't take things seriously enough usually irritate me]
Questions [31. I listen to other people's points of view before putting my own forward]
Questions [32. I tend to be open about how I'm feeling]
Questions [33. In discussions I enjoy watching the manoeuvrings of the other participants]
Questions [34. I prefer to respond to events on a spontaneous, flexible basis rather than plan things out in advance]
Questions [35. I tend to be attracted to techniques such as network analysis, flow charts, branching programs, contingency planning, etc.]
Questions [36. It worries me if I have to rush out a piece of work to meet a tight deadline]
Questions [37. I tend to judge people's ideas on their practical merits]
Questions [38. Quiet, thoughtful people tend to make me feel uneasy]
Questions [39. I often get irritated by people who want to rush things]
Questions [40. It is more important to enjoy the present moment than to think about the past or future]
Questions [41. I think that decisions based on a thorough analysis of all the information are sounder than those based on intuition]
Questions [42. I tend to be a perfectionist]
Questions [43. In discussions I usually produce lots of spontaneous ideas]
Questions [44. In meetings I put forward practical realistic ideas]
Questions [45. More often than not, rules are there to be broken]
Questions [46. I prefer to stand back from a situation]
Questions [47. I can often see inconsistencies and weaknesses in other people's arguments]
Questions [48. On balance I talk more than I listen]
Questions [49. I can often see better, more practical ways to get things done]
Questions [50. I think written reports should be short and to the point]
Questions [51. I believe that rational, logical thinking should win the day]
Questions [52. I tend to discuss specific things with people rather than engaging in social discussion]
Questions [53. I like people who approach things realistically rather than theoretically]
Questions [54. In discussions I get impatient with irrelevancies and digressions]
Questions [55. If I have a report to write I tend to produce lots of drafts before settling on the final version]
Questions [56. I am keen to try things out to see if they work in practice]
Questions [57. I am keen to reach answers via a logical approach]
Questions [58. I enjoy being the one that talks a lot]
Questions [59. In discussions I often find I am the realist, keeping people to the point and avoiding wild speculations]
Questions [60. I like to ponder many alternatives before making up my mind]
Questions [61. In discussions with people I often find I am the most dispassionate and objective]
Questions [62. In discussions I'm more likely to adopt a "low profile" than to take the lead and do most of the talking]
Questions [63. I like to be able to relate current actions to a longer term bigger picture]
Questions [64. When things go wrong I am happy to shrug it off and "put it down to experience"]

Questions [66. It's best to think carefully before taking action]

Questions [69. Most times I believe the end justifies the means]
Questions [70. I don't mind hurting people's feelings so long as the job gets done]

Questions [72. I'm usually one of the people who puts life into a party]

Questions [75. I am keen on exploring the basic assumptions, principles and theories underpinning things and events]
